description: A small lighthouse and sea train station located in the middle of the ocean, serving as a quick stop for the Puffing Tom. It is operated by Kokoro, with her granddaughter Chimney and Gonbe also residing there.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Arrive at Shift Station
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates arrive at Shift Station where they meet Kokoro, Chimney, and Gonbe for the first time.
keyEvents.significance: The location where the crew learns about Water 7 and the sea train system, setting up the next major arc.

keyEvents.title: Kokoro Explains Water 7 and the Sea Train
keyEvents.description: At Shift Station, Kokoro provides crucial information about Water 7 and the Puffing Tom, directing the Straw Hats to their next destination.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the Water 7 Saga by providing the crew with their next destination and goal.

statusHistory.reason: Operating lighthouse and sea train station

name.japanese: ロングリングロングランド

description: An unusual island in Paradise characterized by its long, narrow landmasses that appear and disappear based on tidal patterns. The site of the Davy Back Fight and the crew's encounter with Admiral Aokiji.

keyEvents.title: Luffy vs Aokiji Battle Begins
keyEvents.description: Luffy challenges Admiral Aokiji to a one-on-one duel at Long Ring Long Land to protect his crew.
keyEvents.significance: The site of one of Luffy's most devastating defeats against a Marine Admiral.

keyEvents.title: Luffy Frozen by Aokiji
keyEvents.description: At Long Ring Long Land, Aokiji defeats and freezes Luffy with his Ice Time technique.
keyEvents.significance: A pivotal moment showing the overwhelming power difference between Luffy and an Admiral.

keyEvents.title: Four Days of Recovery
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats remain at Long Ring Long Land for four days while Luffy and Robin recover from being frozen.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the real consequences and recovery time needed after such a devastating encounter.

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel gifted by Kaya and designed by Merry. The crew's home and transportation throughout the East Blue and early Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Crew Thaws Robin on the Going Merry
keyEvents.description: Usopp and Chopper bring the frozen Robin to the Going Merry and use the ship's shower to carefully thaw her.
keyEvents.significance: The Going Merry serves as a safe haven for the crew to perform the delicate rescue operation.

keyEvents.title: Robin and Luffy Recover on the Ship
keyEvents.description: Both Robin and Luffy's hearts resume beating after being thawed on the Going Merry, with Chopper providing medical care.
keyEvents.significance: The ship continues to serve as the crew's sanctuary and recovery center.

statusHistory.reason: Serving as the Straw Hat Pirates' ship
